fhparry.name: Parry Prototype
fhparry.desc: Timing-based inputs during enemy attacks. Toggle or tweak the window here.
fhparry.enabled.name: Enable Parry
fhparry.enabled.desc: Master switch for the parry helper.
fhparry.indicator.name: Show Visual Indicator
fhparry.indicator.desc: Draws an overlay whenever the parry window is open.
fhparry.audio.name: Play Audio Feedback
fhparry.audio.desc: Trigger in-game hit SEs when a parry succeeds.
fhparry.ctb.name: Boost Overdrive Gauge
fhparry.ctb.desc: Grant a small Overdrive gain to defenders on a successful parry.
fhparry.negate.name: Negate Damage
fhparry.negate.desc: Attempt to nullify the next incoming damage when a parry succeeds.
fhparry.logging.name: Debug Logging
fhparry.logging.desc: Write additional parry state changes to the log when enabled.
fhparry.window_seconds.name: Parry Window (seconds)
fhparry.window_seconds.desc: Applies only to the legacy timer. Sets how long the parry input remains active after opening.
fhparry.lead_physical.name: Physical Lead Delay
fhparry.lead_physical.desc: Delay, in seconds, before opening the window for melee attacks.
fhparry.lead_magic.name: Magic Lead Delay
fhparry.lead_magic.desc: Delay, in seconds, applied before spells or abilities can be parried.
fhparry.future.name: Future Features
fhparry.timing_mode.name: Timing Mode
fhparry.timing_mode.desc: Switch between the legacy fixed window and the new on-hit clamp.
fhparry.resolve_window.name: Resolve Window Cap (seconds)
fhparry.resolve_window.desc: Maximum time the ApplyDamage window stays open if no damage event arrives.
